title: Avimiled Rivas
text:
Avimiled Rivas Quintero (born 17 October 1984 in <a href="Santiago%20de%20Cali">Cali</a>) is a Colombian <a href="association%20football">football</a> player who has played for <a href="Club%20Deportivo%20Los%20Millonarios">Millonarios</a>, <a href="Deportes%20Quind%C3%ADo">Deportes Quindío</a>, <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20Nacional">Atlético Nacional</a>, <a href="Polideportivo%20Ejido">CP Ejido</a>, <a href="SD%20Eibar">SD Eibar</a> and <a href="Once%20Caldas">Once Caldas</a>, as well as the <a href="Colombia%20national%20football%20team">Colombian national team</a>. Rivas currently plays for <a href="Cortulu%C3%A1">Cortuluá</a> as an <a href="attacking%20midfielder">attacking midfielder</a>.
With the <a href="Colombia%20national%20football%20team">Colombia national football team</a>, he won the <a href="South%20American%20Youth%20Championship">South American Youth Championship</a> in 2005 and played the <a href="2003%20FIFA%20World%20Youth%20Championship">2003 FIFA World Youth Championship</a> reaching the semi final and beating Argentina 2-1
